articleArray.title: Makeda Run
paragraphs: I released a mobile game on Android and iOS!  The game is called Makeda Run and it's a free endless runner that you can download and play now!
Check out the game on iOS and Android.

articleArray.title: Endless Donuts
paragraphs: I had a lot of fun making a website that generates an endless number of donuts.
Check out the repo here and see the website for yourself here.

articleArray.title: Hang the DJ
paragraphs: I made a fun web app that imitates the "tap to reveal" feature the computer used in the episode of Black Mirror called "Hang the DJ".
Check out the repo here and try out the app here.

articleArray.title: Cryptocurrency Position Tracker
paragraphs: I made a web app that lets you enter a position of a cryptocurrency and then will show the change in value.  It's useful for tracking crypto trades.

articleArray.title: Magspoof
paragraphs: I made my own version of Samy Kamkar's Magspoof. It's a small device that can be used to emulate the action of swiping a credit card.
Check out the repo here. Included in the repo are the slides I used during my talks at 49th SD about Magspoof.

articleArray.title: Online Code Words
paragraphs: I made an online version of the popular board game "Code Names."  It uses simple PHP to run the backend and offers realtime updates to the players.

articleArray.title: Where Should I Go?
paragraphs: For HackNC 2017 my partner, Makeda Phoenix, and I made a web app that uses the Google Maps API to randomly pick somewhere to go for when you want to try something new.

articleArray.title: Wearable Smart Devices in Fashion
paragraphs: As a part of the Statement Making Fashion Show at UNCC, a fashion show dedicated to wearable technology, I worked on a piece with my partner, Makeda Phoenix.  We made a skirt that used a Raspberry Pi to query an API that gave us real time information about lightning strikes in the area.  We then used LEDs to light up the skirt when a lightning strike was detected.

articleArray.title: Arduino LED Clock
paragraphs: I made a custom clock using an Arduino and some RGB LEDs. You can check out the full write up here.

articleArray.title: The Cargo Hold
paragraphs: The Cargo Hold is a short documentary I made in high school about the Green Hope programming classroom and the influential teacher there, Mr. Gaw.
You can watch the whole documentary here.
